comments.text:
Westboro Baptist Church members are NOT Christians at all. That is just a 
label on the building. They are most definitely a CULT and the members are 
brainwashed. You know The Lord Jesus didn't treat sinners with such 
arrogance or beat them over the head with the word. No not at all, he 
showed them the right way and walked in love towards them. It was his deep 
love and care he had for them that touched their hearts. Everywhere he 
went, he walked in love that no person had seen such a man as him ever. He 
was and is strong, wise, gentle and all powerful who LOVES children so much 
so, he want us as Christians come to The Father as a little child (trusting 
at heart). 
God never tormented the broken hearted at all, he had mercy on them. The 
families going to the funerals are broken hearted and my God wants to bring 
comfort to them.

No, I will never take sides with the kkk. The organization did many rotten 
things to women and children. Not me, they are trash.

HOWEVER, I DO VERY MUCH WOULD SUPPORT ANONYMOUS FOR THE FACT THEY ARE FOR 
THE PEOPLE, THE UNDERDOG. THEY FIGHT AGAINST BULLIES OF ALL KINDS. I DO 
HOPE THE REALLY GO AFTER ISIS MUCH, MUCH HARDER.﻿
comments.author: amchalmers06

comments.text:
Hate isn't a good response to these people. It's so so so very easy to 
hate....far harder to stop hating. These people live and breathe hate. 
Their goal is to spread it as much as they can. Responding with hate only 
fuels their fire. What I love seeing is the people coming out in force with 
signs like "God is Love" and "God Loves Peace." The Westboro people WANT 
you to respond with hate and anger. What they don't want is their message 
to be made light of. To be ignored. For people to respond by pulling 
together in a peaceful way. If there is any real thing the Westboro people 
have achieved, though they didn't intend it, it's to prove that we CAN 
stand together, sing together, coexist peacefully in the face of such pure 
hatred. Watching these towns stand up for peace and love makes me proud of 
this country and makes the haters seems so insignificant as to be 
pointless.﻿

comments.author: GEE RAM

comments.text:
If the Westboro Baptist Church were planning to prevent people from 
conducting this remembrance service or otherwise doing something more 
aggressive than simply voicing stupid, disrespectful bullshit, I'd agree 
with Anonymous threatening to take action. However, while I totally agree 
that it's disrespectful, archaic and regressive what the WBC does, I don't 
think it's much better to try to attack someone's right to free speech (as 
long as it really is just verbally expressing an opinion) and then pass the 
act off as ''Justice''- no matter how stupid and bullshit I find these 
particular opinions to be.
Though I guess that's what happens when you have a dysfunctional humanity 
that relies too much upon the internet.﻿
comments.author: Fried Waters

comments.text:
As I always say...Your right to free speech and the first amendment is 
important and you should use it as you have right to, but I also am a firm 
believer that there is a time and a place for everything to be said and 
done.

Doing these protests and saying these hateful and disgusting things at a 
service for 20 dead children and screaming at the parents and family alike 
of the victims is not the time nor the place. 

If people would exercise that bit of common sense I think we'd have a few 
level headed people out there...

comments.author: aerah //

comments.text:
The First Amendment to the United States Constitution provides that 
"Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or 
prohibiting the free exercise thereof ..." and Article VI specifies that 
"no religious Test shall ever be required as a Qualification to any Office 
or public Trust under the United States."
comments.author: aerah //

comments.text:
"Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or 
prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom of speech, 
or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to 
petition the Government for a redress of grievances."

Children have the right to pray and practice in school the same as people 
who don't want to pray and practice in school have the right not to.

Children are no longer allowed to pray in schools due to laws prohibiting 
free exercise thereof.

TYT. Get your shit together.﻿

comments.author: Andrew Norris

comments.text:
I'm surprised to see that Young Turks isn't informed enough to know that 
"Anonymous" is actually a CIA front. In the 70s and early 80s, the CIA/FBI 
and the RCMP here in Canada created left wing organizations in order to 
control dissent and spread confusion and distrust (For example the Canadian 
Communist Party / Marxist-Leninist, was created by the mounted police and 
had informers and top levels). "Anonymous" is a modern version of that 
political and ideological work that Western governments do in order to
